dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Akkad covers the boys mouth. Japheth bites into him. Akkad lifts Japheth over his head ready to crush him against the wall of The Ark. Ham swings an awl into Akkad’s bad leg drawing blood. Akkad in pain drops Japheth. Ham grabs his younger brother’s hand and rushes through the

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL QUARTERS
dialogues.text: Ham looks back in terror. No one follows.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ILA’S HUT Naameh finally gets what Noah is doing. Wide-eyed she looks at Ila, then back at Noah.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: It can’t be. Noah takes out a thin metal blade. He goes to Ila.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: What is it? Noah doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: How could it be?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: {to Ila) Give me your finger.  87. Ila looks to her father for an explanation. None comes. She gives him her hand. MNoah pricks her finger. Blood bubbles onto her fingertip. He drips blood into the bowl. He watches the blood drop diffuse, turning the water a pale red. Noah and Naameh stare into the bowl waiting, anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Noah turns. Japheth and Ham rush in.

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH
dialogues.text: There is a man. He grabbed me!

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: What? Who is it? Japheth looks at Ham.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (to Ham) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: Akkad. Noah’s face hardens.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: NOAH‘’S WORKSHOP Shem and Noah arm themselves. CcUr TO: ILA’S HUT Ham toys with his scrap of Na’eltamuk’s shirt. He paces, unsure what to do, then rushes out. Ila watches her mother stare into the bowl of water and herbs.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: What does it say?  88.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: A minute, and we will know. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL QUARTERS
dialogues.text: Noah and Shem march past the sleeping cargo into the

dialogues.speaker: STORAGE ROOM
dialogues.text: It is abandoned. Shem spots a blood trail. They follow it a few feet and it stops. A drip hits the ground. They both look up. It’s coming from up above, towards the roof.

dialogues.speaker: CUI TO
dialogues.text: ILA’S HUT In the test bowl, the pale red water slowly turns yellow. Naameh cannot believe her eyes. Then she figures it out.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: You saw grandfather. Ila grasps to understand.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: What did he do to you?

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: Why? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Daughter, you are not sick. You are pregnant. Ila‘s jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: (stunned) But it is impossible. Then she gets it. She starts to cry. Tears of joy.

dialogues.speaker: ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: The deck is covered with a sheen of black ice. Hail and sleet thunder down on the dark sea. Shem climbs out first. Akkad is waiting. -He smashes him in the head with a plank. The young man goes down. Noah leaps onto Akkad. Akkad is ready. His dagger cuts into Noah’s stomach. But, Noah’s force smashes both men into the hard deck. Weapons are knocked free and slip into the sea. Noah shoots away nursing his wound.

dialogues.speaker: AKKAD
dialogues.text: You lied to me. You cheated me. You cheated the human race. I should have killed you a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You were too busy leading your people astray.

dialogues.speaker: AKKAD
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) You are a shining example of paternal leadership. (firm) Your own son hates you and wishes to betray you. Noah’s eyes tighten. He reaches for Akkad’s bison-horn medallion and rips it from his neck. Akkad leaps and tackles Noah. The horn slips from his hand. The enemies wrestle on the icy deck. A brutal fight to the finish. At the edge of the roof, Akkad breaks free. He kicks Noah in the face. Noah slips off the side of the ship. But he grabs the slippery iedge. He hangs for dear life as the ice cold sea laps at his fe

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ILA’S HUT Naameh dumps the yellow liquid out the side of the Ark.  Ke 90.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: But it is his grandchild.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: You‘ve heard his beliefs. You know his conviction. His stubbornness.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: (getting hysterical) Then what will we do?

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: He must not know. We have to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: On this Ark. How? How can I hide life inside me from father!?

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Start by hiding your tears. (then) Your blood betrayed you. So we will give you mine. Naameh reaches for the blade Noah used to draw blood.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE EDGE OF THE ARK’S ROOF Akkad smirks at Noah who clings for his life.

dialogues.speaker: AKKAD
dialogues.text: Know this as you die: first I will kill your sons. Then I will take your wife, your daughter. I will sire a whole new army, with an entire world at our mercy. Akkad lifts his leg, poised to crush Noah’s fingers. When suddenly, he stops. Blood trickles out of his mouth, He falls forward over Noah into the freezing sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His death complete.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Ham, now a man, stands over Noah with the weapon that murdered Akkad. It was the bison horn. Noah hangs from the edge, his strength slipping. Ham just watches.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: She was innocent father. She was good. He drops the horn into the sea and turns away. Shem rushes up, conscious now.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Ham, father! Help him. Ham doesn’t help. He keeps going. Shem pulls Noah up. Noah catches his breath as Shem notices the blood from his father’s side.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: You‘re hurt. Shem starts to apply pressure. Noah pushes Shem away and rushes through the rain back into the Ark. cuUT TO: ILA’S HUT Naameh has filled the bowl with water and herbs again. She takes the blade and cuts her own finger. As she squeezes a drop of her blood into the bowl, Noah enters soaked and dripping.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Ila stands up. She stares at her father. A protective hand slides across her belly. Shem enters and notices Ila’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: Shem Shem comes to her. Naameh tries to change the subject.  92.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: You’re hurt! She moves to tend Noah. He pushes her away.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: It is true, isn’t it? Ila can’t lie.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: It’s a miracle father. A blessing.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOO
dialogues.text: Noah smashes the bowl and storms out. Ila smiles through her tears at Shem.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: You are to be a father. Shem is deeply shocked, worried. But as he walks towards Ila, joy bubbles up through his concern.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: It cannot be... must not be. The Creator’s plan... father’s work... We mustn’t... we are the last. No babies. He reaches Ila, touches her, bursts with love.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Our baby. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Noah wrecks the room. He stomps around smashing all in sight. Then he collapses to the ground and starts to cry. At first small tears. Then deep sobs. And as he cries the world shifts. The rain starts to slow. At first we hear it: The pounding of water on wood we’ve heard since the flood began starts to lighten. Then we see it out the hatch: The rain just disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ILA’S HUT Shem kisses Ila’s belly. Her tears slow. And then a deafening silence as 40 days of drumming rain suddenly ceases. They rush into

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Everyone crowds around the hatchway staring out at the

dialogues.speaker: ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: Noah stands in the cool dry air, staring at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Father? Noah turns to look at his family. His tears are gone.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: The rains have stopped. The Creator smiles on our child. Won’t you bless us, too? A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: The rains have stopped because of your child, yes. And if it is a boy it shall receive my blessing. He will take Japheth’s place, the last man. Noah pushes past them into the Ark. He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: But if it is a girl, a nascent mother, then it must die.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Are you mad!? This is my child!

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Should you bear a girl - in the moment of her birth I will cut her down. Ila screams in horror. Noah collapses to one knee. Then, he crumples to the ground. Quickly, everything FADES TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until

dialogues.speaker: A HAND
dialogues.text: Carries a stone. Brother kills brother. In

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: Once again we hear CRIES, SHOUTS, SCREAMS of death, war, and brutality. The CACOPHONY becomes DISSONANCE. The DISSONANCE becomes WHITE NOISE. It bangs

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Into consciousness for a moment. Then, he slides back into the throes of his own personal fever.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: No. Please, no. Naameh tends him. But even she can’t stop him from FADING INTO BLACKNESS. And these words emerge: Genesis 7.17 And the waters prevailed so mightily upon the Earth that all the high mountains under the whole heaven were covered. All in whose nostrils was the breath of life had died. Only Noah remained alive, and they that were with him in the Ark. Return to NOAH’S HUT Slowly he wakes. WNaameh notices. She comes to him.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: There you are. Feeling better. Noah is. Then he remembers Ila. He sits up quickly.  95.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Tla.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: She is fine. Upset by what you said. I told her it was the fever. Noah looks at his wife. He is completely serious.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: You know it was not. Naameh’s face falls. She dared hope, but she knew.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Could you really do this thing?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Enough!! I do what I must! Noah gets up and leaves Naameh to stare in shock. In the

dialogues.speaker: HEARTH
dialogues.text: Shem watches Noah storm to his workshop. Naameh scurries into Ila’s hut. Shem follows. cur TO: NOAH’S WORKSHOP Noah holds his face against the pain of it all. He opens Og’s box. He looks at the branch inside. He hears TIla’s cries as she hears Naameh’s news. He closes the box and puts it away.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: Ila stares at the horizon. All is covered with sea. Shem comes up behind her and puts an arm on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: What will we do?

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: our father is a monster. I do not know. Ila doesn’t lcok at him. She just stares out.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: Your hands built this Ark. Shem nods.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: Build another. For us. Us three. Shem latches onto the idea. He starts Looking around, planning. He yanks a plank up off of the Ark. Ila just stares out. All still covered with sea. FADE TO BLACK. Return to

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Shem builds furicusly. The frame of a twenty foot boat is taking shape. Shem looks over at Ila. She is five months pregnant. Her eyes fill him with strength. She senses someone. Shem looks. It is Noah, watching. His sunken eyes and protruding cheeks retreat into the darkness. FADE TO BLACK. Only these words: Genesis 7.23 And the waters prevailed upon the Earth one hundred and fifty days.

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Shem sands the hull of the finished boat. Ham enters.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: He will not just let you go.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: What else can we do? Shem sees the hate in Ham’s eyes. Shem shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: No. Not that.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: Not yet. cur TO: ILA’S HUT Ila is seven months pregnant. Shem massages her feet,

dialogues.speaker: . TILA
dialogues.text: coal Let’s go now. Get away from him.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: We won’t last long in that boat. If we do not find land we will starve. We should wait ‘til the last moment, then go.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I want to risk the seas. He holds her.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Let’s eat now. They exit into

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Naameh serves a meal. The family eats silently. She takes a plate a food and walks out onto

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: Noah sits alone. Eyes shut he thinks.
Naameh offers him the food.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Eat. You need to eat. He does not take it.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: You have not eaten in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: How can I?

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: You could relent.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: It is not my choice.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Grandfather said it is.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Grandfather? He’s cursed me! Does he know the Creator’s will?

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Do you? Noah laughs to himself.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Do I? Look. Look out at our world. Noah points to edge of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: I don’t see anything.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Exactly. And you won’t until Ila gives birth. The rain stopped months ago. Yet the waters remain. Why? Because He must be sure the new world will be as He intends. That I will do what I must do. If you love them do not let them go. There is no land. They will die out there. Noah tosses his plate of food into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: How can you be sure?  99.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Sure?! Noah looks up to the sky. He gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: I will show you. Noah storms into

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: The family still eats. Noah stops to look at his kin.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Japheth. Come, help me. Japheth looks at his father, at Ila, at Ham. Ham shrugs. Noah slips into the darkness. Japheth follows. cur TO: NOAH’S WORKSHOP Japheth helps Noah chop and mix herbs on his work table. Noah collects the mixture in a bowl. cur Tos

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL QUARTERS
dialogues.text: Noah walks swiftly through the great hall of sleeping creatures. Japheth behind him. Noah climbs up until he finds the sleeping ravens. He peels the male RAVEN from its mate. It sleeps in his arms as he pets it. With a stone flint he shoots a spark onto the herbal mix. It smokes as it burns. Noah blows a thin stream of smoke into the Raven’s nostrils. Slowly the Raven wakes. The Raven SQUAWKS. Noah carries it back to

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: His family looks at them. The Raven SQUAWKS again.  100.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: (explains) The raven. Perhaps The Creator’s most intelligent winged creature. And keen eyesight to match. If there is land out there - he will find it. Ila and Shem look at each other. Noah walks out. Everyone but Ham follows him out onto

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: Noah raises the bird out on an outstretched hand. He shoots it off into the air. The Raven takes flight. It circles the Ark once and then flaps off to a distant horizon. FADE TO BLACK. Return to

dialogues.speaker: THE MIDDLE OF THE SEA
dialogues.text: Looking back at the Ark. No rain. No wind. No waves. Aix, sea and sky all gray and still and flat. Rising up off the water, tne Raven shoots past us returning home.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: Japheth waits. He keeps himself busy with a stick. He senses something, looks up. The Raven approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH
dialogues.text: THE RAVEN! If’S COME BACK! Everyone rushes out. Ila carries a huge weight and is extremely tired. Noah walks to the edge of the roof and stretches out his hand. The Raven lands on his forearm. It blinks. He examines its feet.  101.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: No mud. No dirt. Nothing. (to Naameh) The Creator waits for the birth. The Raven flaps down to the roof. Noah goes inside. Tla cries on Shem’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Shh now. Courage. When it is our child’s time, we will be away from here.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: Away? There’s nowhere for us to go.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: We will find a way. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: (tearful, hopeful, desperate) Maybe it will be a boy?

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Maybe. But Noah shall never know. After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Come, inside now. Shem leads her inside. She can’t stop crying. Japheth watches them go. He looks over at the Raven. He bends to pick it up but the big black bird snaps at him. curt To: NOAH’S WORKSHOP Japheth sneaks inside. He picks up the bowl of herbs and a flint stone and heads into the

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL QUARTERS
dialogues.text: He looks at the different birds. So many to choose from. Then he spots the doves. Our DOVE. He sparks the incense. He blows smoke toward the Dove.  102. Slowly, the bird awakes. It ruffles it’s feathers.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ILA’S HUT Ila rests, still erying.

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sister?

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: Japheth. The young boy enters with the Dove.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: My dove? You woke it.

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: Father will be angry.

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH
dialogues.text: Angrier than he already is? Ila accepts this.

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH
dialogues.text: The raven is smart, maybe too smart.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH
dialogues.text: Maybe he sees all the water and gives up. The dove is more simple. His eyes are. not as good as the raven’s but he always flies home. He will never give up until he gets there. Maybe he will go further and find us land. She doesn’t hold much faith in the idea, but her brother’s love have dried her tears. She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: Thank you, brother. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: Japheth walks out into the daylight. The Raven SQUAWKS at him. He ignores it and let’s the Dove go, The bird flies straight and true towards the setting sun. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: THE ARK
dialogues.text: At night, floating on a black sea. No stars only clouds.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Everyone sleeps. The animals sleep. The reptiles, the birds, the mammals - everything. Noah sleeps on the floor in his workshop. Naameh sleeps alone on a bed made for two. Japheth sleeps on the roof of the Ark waiting for the Dove. His lizard curled up at his side. Ham sleeps. Shem sleeps too. In all creation, only Ila is awake. Out in a corner of

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: She squats in pain. Her forehead covered with sweat. She swallows a cry of pain. Terror lights her eyes. In ILA‘’S HUT Shem suddenly wakes. He feels for his mate. Nothing. He shoots up in bed and looks around. He scurries into

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: In the darkness he spots her sweat stained face. He rushes to her. Ila’s eyes tell him everything.
HAM‘’S HUT Shem covers Ham’s mouth and shakes him awake. Whispers:

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: It’s time. Ham nods. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: With pulleys the brothers hoist the raft into the sea. The splash wakes Japheth up on the roof. The boy locks down and sees Shem checking the small boat for leaks. Japheth scans the sky for the Dove. ON SHEM’S BOAT Everything seems set. Dawn arrives through the clouds. He signals silently to Ham. Ham rushes into ILA’S HUT Naameh holds Ila’s hand. She cools her brow with a wet cloth. Ham and Naameh help Ila up. cur TO: NOAH’S WORKSHOP Sure enough Noah is awake. His face is filled with absolute conviction.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE OF THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Shem beckons Ila into the boat. Naameh starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: Fear not mother. We shall find each other in the new world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug. Shem beckons again but something catches his eye. A tiny HERRING FISH leaps onto deck. It flaps around trying to breathe. Shem is bewildered. He reaches to pick it up when another fish leaps on board.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: Japheth spots a speck on the horizon. The dove?

dialogues.speaker: THE RAFT
dialogues.text: Shem stares at the dying fish. Beat. Ten more jump on board. Then, a whole school. He panics.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: (to Tla) Get back! He looks over the side of the boat. From the dark purple sea a shape rises towards him. He leaps for the pulley ropes just as a giant ORCA smashes through the bow of the escape boat. A pod of whales follow close behind, cresting out of the sea everywhere, reducing the raft to splinters. Shem safely hangs on a rope. He scampers up into

dialogues.speaker: THE HEARTH
dialogues.text: Ila hugs him. He hugs back. Scared. The whales cry out as if talking to Noah. Shem sees his father watching. His anger grows but:

dialogues.speaker: JAPHETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The Dove: The Dove! From

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE ARK
dialogues.text: They hear Japheth scream. Everyone rushes outside. The exhausted bird fights to maintain altitude. It sinks, almost hits the water, then fights to get air. As it gets closer a wind picks up. JIla’s hair blows in the gust. The still waters of the sea are pushed into choppy foam. The Dove is buoyed the last few yards towards the Ark. It collapses onto the deck. Japheth rushes over. He picks up the bird. It pants, its chest heaves. He. examines the feet. Clean, no mud. Nothing there. Ila reads her young brother’s body language.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: Nothing. Satisfied, Noah returns inside. Shem picks up a long wooden pole. Ham sees the fury.

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: (whispers) We do it now! Shem descends upon Noah. Ham follows with clenched fists.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Boys, NO! Outside of NOAH’S WORKSHOP Shem swings for the back of Noah’s neck. An inch from impact, Noah is ready. He spins around, blocks the weapon, twists his son’s wrist, tosses him to the ground. With Shem’s pole, he trips Ham and ping him down. Noah plants a knee onto the center of Shem’s chest. He stares into his son’s helpless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH
dialogues.text: Tf it is a boy, it can live. But if it is a girl, it must die. Noah tosses Shem aside and disappears into his workshop.  107. } Shem tries to go in after him but Naameh and Ila hold h - back.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: No, Shem, no. Just, then

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE SEA
dialogues.text: The bottom of the ARK SCRAPES against an undersea mountaintop.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: The jolt tosses everyone around. Ila screams as she hits the ground. Shem rushes to her side.

dialogues.speaker: TLA
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: We’ve run aground. Noah leaps out of his workshop. He rushes off to check the Ark. .

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: Oh my... Water leaks out from between her legs.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: It‘s begun.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: Mother. What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Your water has broken. The baby moves under the sxin of Ila’s belly.

dialogues.speaker: ILA
dialogues.text: This can’t be, it’s too goon.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: j Calm down daughter. It’s not too aa soon. It’s time. Shem springs to action. He looks to his brother.

dialogues.speaker: SHEM
dialogues.text: Help me take her down!

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: STORAGE ROOM
dialogues.text: Akkad’s old hideaway has been updated by Shem and Ham. The room is now a substantial defense. It is stocked with supplies. Shem and Ham carry Ila into a small

dialogues.speaker: BIRTHING HUT
dialogues.text: Naameh follows them in, surprised by what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: NAAMEH
dialogues.text: What’s all this?

dialogues.speaker: HAM
dialogues.text: I knew he wouldn’t let them go.
